page.title: 06Somerset Floods July 1968.
page.content: Keynsham looks like it does now because of the floods in North Somer- set in July 1968. On the 9th July there were tremendous thunderstorms and the River Chew rose until the banks finally burst. A wall of water rushed down the valley and damaged everything in its path. Three bridges were badly damaged and one was completely destroyed (the Avon Mill Lane Bridge over the Chew). The bridges over the Chew at Bath Hill and over the River Avon to Willsbridge were rebuilt. The bridge over the Chew at Dapps Hill was repaired. A car was swept off of Bath Hill Bridge. Charles Kaye was swept out of the car and he clung on to a tree for five hours before being saved. The other three people in the car were drowned.
